children.name: Bright id
children.description: BrightID is a social identity network that allows you to prove that you’re only using one account.

children.name: Serto
children.description: Serto is decentralized identity platform aiming to make it easy for everyone to exchange data in a trusted, private and scalable way. Create decentralized identifiers (DIDs), and issue and validate verifiable credentials (VCs). Search and discover DIDs and VCs

children.name: AMP
children.description: Amp is a decentralized collateral token, built on Ethereum, that enables instant transactions with digital assets

children.name: Aragon
children.description: Build your Decentralized Autonomous Organization on open-source infrastructure with governance plugins

children.name: Arbitrum
children.description: Next generation layer 2 for Ethereum dApps. Use your favorite tools and scale your dApp at the lowest cost. Arbitrum is a suite of Ethereum scaling solutions that enables high-throughput, low cost smart contracts while remaining trustlessly secure

children.name: Chainlink
children.description: Chainlink decentralized oracle networks provide tamper-proof inputs, outputs, and computations to support advanced smart contracts on any blockchain

children.name: Consensys
children.description: Consensys develops full-stack Ethereum products to help developers build next-generation networks and enable enterprises to launch more powerful financial infrastructure

children.name: Bison Trails
children.description: Bison Trails provides a suite of easy-to-use infrastructure products and services on multiple blockchains. Run secure, fully managed node clusters; connect to blockchain data on 33 protocols to build Web3.0 applications; stake digital assets securely in 12 protocols; access structured blockchain data and transaction information

children.name: Ethereum
children.description: Ethereum is open access to digital money and data-friendly services for everyone – no matter your background or location. It's a community-built technology behind the cryptocurrency ether (ETH) and thousands of applications you can use today

children.name: Nucypher
children.description: Cryptographic infrastructure for privacy-preserving applications

children.name: Get block
children.description: GetBlock is a blockchain nodes provider. Connect to Bitcoin, Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain and other nodes with JSON-RPC, REST and WebSockets APIs

children.name: Loom
children.description: Loom Network is a multichain interoperability platform that's connected to other major blockchains such as Ethereum, Binance Chain, and Tron.

children.name: Polygon
children.description: Polygon is a protocol and a framework for building and connecting Ethereum-compatible blockchain networks

children.name: Ren
children.description: Access tokens from any blockchain using your existing smart contracts without having to worry about wrapping or unwrapping tokens.

children.name: Ramp
children.description: Allow people to buy crypto without leaving your dApp or wallet

children.name: Skynet
children.description: Decentralized storage without needing to run a node or wallet. Skynet also includes SDKs for popular programming languages and APIs that integrate seamlessly with your existing apps

children.name: Synthetix
children.description: Synthetix is a decentralized synthetic asset issuance protocol. It allows people to stake its native token, SNX, over periods of time, in exchange of synthetic assets, which may reflect fiat (or crypto-) currencies, commodities, and other sorts of financial assets. By cultivating an ecosystem of synths backed by a single collateral, the protocol allows people to gain exposure to a variety of assets, as well as trade them for one another in an efficient way.

children.name: UMA
children.description: UMA builds open-source infrastructure for “priceless” financial contracts on Ethereum. Specifically, this is two things: Priceless financial contract templates used to create synthetic tokens; Decentralized Oracle Service used to manage and enforce contracts on UMA. Together, these two technologies enable the creation of fast, efficient, and secure derivatives on Ethereum.

children.name: Wallet connect
children.description: WalletConnect is an open source protocol for connecting decentralised applications to mobile wallets with QR code scanning or deep linking. People can interact securely with any Dapp from their mobile phone, making WalletConnect wallets a safer choice compared to desktop or browser extension wallets.

children.name: Austin Griffith's ETH repos
children.description: Includes scaffold-etc, a forkable Ethereum dev stack focused on fast product iterations, eth.build an educational sandbox for building on web3. Visually understand how Ethereum works by doing

children.name: Graph protocol
children.description: The Graph is an indexing protocol for querying networks like Ethereum and IPFS. Anyone can build and publish open APIs, called subgraphs, making data easily accessible.

children.name: Ethers-io
children.description: The ethers.js library aims to be a complete and compact library for interacting with the Ethereum Blockchain and its ecosystem. It was originally designed for use with ethers.io and has since expanded into a more general-purpose library

children.name: Hardhat
children.description: Ethereum development environment. Easily deploy your contracts, run tests and debug Solidity code without dealing with live environments. Hardhat Network is a local Ethereum network designed for development

children.name: Infura
children.description: The foundation for decentralized apps. Fast, high availability Ethereum infrastructure. Connect your app instantly, with a single line of code

children.name: Open zeppelin
children.description: OpenZeppelin provides security products to build, automate, and operate decentralized applications. We also protect leading organizations by performing security audits on their systems and products

children.name: Solidity
children.description: Solidity is a statically-typed curly-braces programming language designed for developing smart contracts that run on Ethereum

children.name: Radicle
children.description: Radicle is a peer-to-peer stack for building software together. For unstoppable, permissionless, decentralized open-source development. Forget platforms. Easily share your code without relying on a third party. No central servers, no censorship. Built on Git, backed by public-key crypto

children.name: Sourcify
children.description: Sourcify is a decentralized automated contract verification service

children.name: Tenderly
children.description: Comprehensive Ethereum Developer Platform for real-time monitoring, alerting, debugging, and simulating Smart Contracts

children.name: Colony
children.description: The Colony Network is a suite of smart contracts, running on Ethereum. It provides a general purpose framework for the essential functions organizations require, such as ownership, structure, authority, and financial management.

children.name: Daohaus
children.description: DAOhaus is a no-code platform for launching and running DAOs. It is owned and operated by the community. All DAOs on the platform utilize the glorious open-source code of Moloch

children.name: Fairmint
children.description: With Fairmint, founders can launch a continuous securities offering based on a fixed percentage of their company's equity. Such offerings enable stakeholders to buy and earn convertible securities at any single time, directly from the company's website.

children.name: Opolis
children.description: Opolis is a next-generation Employment Cooperative offering high-quality, affordable employment benefits and shared services to independent contractors, freelancers, digital nomads, solopreneurs and sole-practitioners.
